comments.commentBody: I think we all know why he's doing this: He just found out he was caught on tape with a Russian who was under US intelligence surveillance. The White House isn't commenting because a) obviously not true, and b) they now know indictments are only a matter of time. It's clear as day, folks.

Is there a solution? Create safe zones guarded by under-strength mercenary UN/AU troops? Srebrenica is probably the most famous example of that strategy. Take the country over for 15 years? The losers in this arrangement won't just roll over, and the global anti-establishment forces will have a proxy battlefield to fund and further prove the fecklessness of the UN. More aid certainly is a necessity in the current emergency, but it has also created so many problems around the developing world. Reparations from former colonial masters/currently fashionable scapegoats will go into the same pockets the oil revenue disappeared in. How do you instill civic responsibility in a governing class and population that has lost whatever democratic traditions may have existed prior to the 19th century? I truly feel for the people of South Sudan, and wish I could delude myself into thinking that sending money and aid is meaningful. But the root causes of the strife there will persist for generations even in the best case scenario. Every time someone complains of the oppression in Ethiopia, Eritrea, or Rwanda, South Sudan should be considered as the alternative.

Foreign intervention hasn't worked that great for us has it?

Do you really think all the fear and hatred will vanish once we arrive or are we supposed to stay indefinitely...

Afghanistan, Iraq, Libya, Syra, etc. etc. etc.

I presume he is referring to the information that various people such as National Security Advisor Flynn had phone calls with the Russians. So this over-reporting is just Trump Derangement Syndrome on the part of the NYT. Obama heads his FBI, FBI reported the calls, so .... You have to understand he is talking to his supporters, who need bits of fresh meat every week to stay healthy and happy and retain shiny coats.

After weeks of denying that any of his trusted campaign aides had any contact with Russia, with no one believing a word that he says, it is time to revert to his plan to stop the bad press.  Make up the most outlandish lies ever and change the conversation from Russia!! It is time for full time professionals in mental health to take over the White House!!  He may not need the hundreds of unfilled positions in government, but he needs help badly. In less than two months we have become the laughingstock of the free world.Russia couldn't ask for more and it is only going to get worse,much worse!!

When I read the article on North Korea next to the false claims by Mr. Trump about wire tapping, I know it will be another sleepless night.  It appears Mr Trump's staff was caught off guard by the tweets because they remained behind in DC.  With no one to distract him with praise, Trump goes a little crazy. He needs to have a 24-7 care taker to protect the country. Why on all that is sane has no one been able to wench the phone from his hands? It is n ow a matter of national security.
How many times do I have to tell you???? They are incapable of governing. Period. End of story.

Welp, i guess bannon was right when he said at cpac that "it's going to get worse." Seriously, though, this is a frightening time we are living through. What happens next? What is the cost of all this? Is Putin getting exactly what he wants? Is Bannon getting exactly what he wants? How can our country recover whatever good will we had built up with groups that are now not only marginalized but demonized? How do we get back on track with regard to our environment? I'm concerned, but words of hope, of love, and of light still ring in my ears. Living in interesting times is great, but lets sing an intersting redemption song, not a nihilitic durge. "YES WE CAN!!!"
It does seem apparent that the NSA, FBI, CIA taps about everyone's phone who is anyone in the world. Why would this be news?

No evidence and out of left field... But we immediately get Lindsey Graham picking up the Trump's paranoid Alt Right gas-lighting news about Obama wiretapping... and validating it by taking it seriously.

"I'll get to the bottom of it?" Graham offers two disturbing alternatives in his speech at Clemson;
1) That Trumps claim is true and Obama has committed the worst breach since Watergate by illegally tapping Trumps phones.
2) Obama legally obtained wiretaps to do so. And that is as bad as Watergate.

He doesn't address the crazy allegation by this paranoid President trump itself. He never says: Number 3, what is REALLY disturbing is that Trump is over the edge already, just 30 days into his presidency...

Senator Graham, are you really willing to jump into the Trump, "I get crazier every day" pot? Why didn't you just make a few phone calls first instead of grandstanding and taking those allegations seriously?

Suddenly McCain and Graham are being perceived as sensible, reasonable conservative Republicans who might be willing to help save America from Donald. That went out the window today. Never for a minute forget that these two senators hold a great disdain for President Obama and the Democrats... and think that are really going to do the right thing for this country. Just look at their cabinet votes...

If you have any doubts, listen to Graham at Clemson tell his audience to "be quiet!" today as they expressed disbelieve that he was taking Trump seriously.

Are you kidding me? He has totally lost whatever elusive grip on reality he was hanging onto. Completely ridiculous, unsubstantiated and reckless accusations against a class act like Mr. Obama. Cannot believe the Republicans continue endorse this raving lunatic! They are as irredeemable as 45.
He goes in and out of reality.

This all seems like another diversionary tactic to incite rabid Trump followers that he is under attack to avoid the inevitable disclosures about communications with Russia. But really, who would need a wire tap! Wouldn't it be just as easy to overhear his classified/private conversations anywhere within earshot of his dinner table at Mar a Lago? The absurdity of Trump is without bounds.

Not mentioned, but Trump is spending his fourth weekend at Mar a Lago! Considering, by Trumps estimation, the U.S. economy is a train wreck, why is he wasting taxpayer money by his constant trips to Mar a Lago? Other news articles have indicated that Trump's travel expenses have already exceeded years of Obama's travel expenditures. What a lying hypocrite in every sense of both words.
Diversion... Keep the focus on Russia, Sessions...
Yes.  Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...and, y'know, Russia!
Baron, a closer look at the article would be of benefit to you, there is oil there. And  at least some of Trumps billionaire plutocrats cabinet members have investments there.
It seems that Argentine players are all over the world from Europe to the Middle East spreading their talent. I am glad that are also here in the US league.
But do any of these guys get called up to the national team?
Might happen but chances are very low. US soccer is not visible in Argentina
Messi's salary would equal three entire MLS rosters, designated players included.

there's a whole level of player right below the national team level that is still very good (think of a very good but not Steph Curry level NBA playmaker fyi) that in the past either stayed home with all the issues there or went to lower teams in Europe (smaller clubs have had payroll/safety issues also)-all of a sudden MLS with stable paychecks and low-key lifestyles looks appealing.  In the case of Valeri he is truly the face of the team in Portland-and Barros Schleotto was legendary in Columbus because he embraced the city, learned English, and pretty much went native (read stories of him having the same back table at a local Starbucks to drink espresso in the AM)

Coal is another example of this president's view to the past to find anything good.  Yesterday's lost jobs, old energy sources, limitations on trade, dying/dead industries, limitations on immigration, bigotry - all looking backward in time.  Making America great requires moving forward.
Trump should ask his Russian friends if they have any recordings from these alleged wiretaps?   They had Hillary's emails.

@Robert,
Exactly! Just let the Times to admit that Trump was wiretapped, let them provide the evidence, and let Obama say that the Trump Tower was wiretapped, but he, Obama, didn't order it - just his DOJ did.

Just how many Republicans are working for Putin and Russian goal to bury us?
Big oil bought into this for unlimited $$$ without any thought of killing us all. Big Oil should be Nationalized and replaced not the ACA. Jail the rest involved in the cover up of Russian coalition -RICO style.. .
Obama needs to sue both Trumpster AND Breitbart for billions. Time to either prove your allegations or go bankrupt

Sorry, but I think you are mistaken. If you go into politics you can expect such plotting: it goes with the territory.

Was it not Donald the Great that started that whole birthing thing about Obama? Or is that itself a lie? That Donald started it, I mean

At Toastmasters I once heard someone say that you can "lie through your teeth". If the purpose is to learn public speaking, that is OK. But outside the class room, one should be careful with lying, of course. One should not make a habit of it.

Unless it is your job: the military to mislead the opponent, in games such as chess, lawyers and a certain profession not mentioned in polite society.

It is hard enough to express oneself clearly. If lying becomes allowed, people may not feel the need to put effort in clear expression.
Sad. So very sad!!

This amazes me. Trump has/had a financial relationship with Russia. Trump invites the Russians to hack Hilary. The DNC is hacked, Hilary is hacked, John Podesta...Mike Flynn was was caught because the US eavesdrops on foreign leaders inside the US - they weren't tapping Mr. Flynn. Jeff Sessions talked with the Russian ambassador and must recuse himself.

Convenient that Breitbart News is the source of Trump's claims. Two words for the President and his administration: Prove it.
Wait, we're gonna actually remove the next president that perjures himself? Because, you know, the last one that did got to keep his job.
